content.description: A nice little sit start that moves through good pinches and sinker jug.
content.location: Left side of Bare Bones Wall

content.description:
Day of the Dead is a beautiful line that starts down low with a good left hand pocket and right hand rail.  Work up bulge and move left to the arete once you have both sinker jug pockets. 

  Really classic problem for the grade.
content.protection: Boulders below the problem are unnerving, but you just really don't want to fall.  Pads may help or make it worse.

content.description: Crown Royale is actually just a minutes walk left from the Bare Bones Wall. You will know it when you see it.  Steep sweeping wall with a sort of shield in the middle.  Get to the good right hand side pull over the lip via pockets and edges, then slap up the little arete with the left hand, and hit the jugs at the top. Classy basalt bouldering.
content.location: Just a minutes walk left from the Bare Bones Wall.

content.description: Bare Bones is a cool little jug haul on excellent holds. Start low on good jugs.  Move up to the small left facing arete.
content.protection: Sand landing, but pads are nice.
content.location: Center of the Bare Bones Wall

content.description: This wall was named for the bleached bones at it's base.  A beautiful chunk of pocketed basalt with very stunning and distinct white streaks.  Home a several excellent problems on near perfect pocketed basalt.
